com.soa.policy.wspolicy

Class ReferencedPolicyFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.soa.policy.wspolicy.ReferencedPolicyFactory

  • public class ReferencedPolicyFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for creating policy based on URI references. The class is provided a set of policy by clients that have located shared policy. Each provided policy is referenced via its wsu:Id attribute. When a client requests a policy via a URI reference, the URI reference is used to locate the referenced policy. If found, the referenced policy is created and returned.

    Only local fragment URI's of the format '#foo' are supported, which will match a referenced policy with an wsu:Id of 'foo'.

    • Method Detail

      • addReferencedPolicy

        public void addReferencedPolicy(org.w3c.dom.Element referencedPolicy,
                                PolicyMarshaller marshaller)
        Indexes a policy element via its wsu:Id attribute so that clients may later request this policy by URI reference.
        Parameters:
        referencedPolicy - - the referenced policy. If the policy does not have a wsu:Id attribute, it is ignored.
        marshaller - - the PolicyMarshaller that can unmarhal the referencedPolicy
        Throws:
        com.digev.fw.exception.GException

      • addReferencedPolicy

        public void addReferencedPolicy(Policy policy)

      • createPolicy

        public Policy createPolicy(java.lang.String uriReference)
                    throws com.digev.fw.exception.GException
        Creates a new policy based on a policy referenced by the given URI reference. The policy returned is newly created and is not a reference to a previously created policy. Only URI references with fragments of the form '#foo' are supported. Such a URI would match a policy with a wsu:Id of 'foo'.
        Parameters:
        uriReference -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        com.digev.fw.exception.GException - - if no reference is found or an error occured creating the policy.
